citation.article-title: Psychromonas kaikoae sp. nov., a novel from the deepest piezophilic bacterium cold-seep sediments in the Japan Trench.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Emended description of the genus Psychromonas (Mountfort et al. 1998)
Psychromonas (Psy.chro.mo'nas. Gr. adj. psychros cold; Gr. fem. n. monas a unit; N.L. n. Psychromonas a cold monad)
Gram-negative, rod- to oval-shaped and motile with a polar flagellum.
Temperature range for growth is below 22Â°C.
Carbohydrates are the principal energy source for growth.
Catalase and cytochrome oxidase test results are positive.
The major isoprenoid quinone is Q-8.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C14:1, C16:0 and C16:1.
The type species is Psychromonas antarctica.
